job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) in Appleton, WI
pros: Amazing quality of patient care when it comes to excellent food cooked from dietary aides, cleanliness is always high quality from the custodians, and as CNAs we always answer call lights appropriately. I like how this skilled-nurshing facility lets us use a pager with a walkie-talkie to communicate with staff on getting help with other patients such as with transfers with patients, and taking are of patients who are a 2 assist. The teamwork from the PM and Noc shift crew are great. We are always willing to help each other and we will communicate with each other in person and through the walkie-talkie. The ratio for CNAs is awesome as well.
cons: Getting paid as a CNA here is not enough to survive during the pandemic and after the pandemic to pay for the bills. During AM shift, there is not much communication and help from each other whenever I pick up to stay over time for AM shift.

review_title: Horrible bosses isn't just a movie title
job_title: Registered Nurse ICU in Appleton, WI
pros: The team I worked with were more than co-workers, we were family. They walked out our manager in March of 2020, before things got really bad. No one from leadership EVER showed up, we were left with literally zero support. So we were together during the worst of covid, when everyone was just dying. All we had was each other during the worst years of my life.
cons: WHERE TO START! Ever since Andrabi became CEO, the entire organization has become a dumpster fire. Just burning garbage. Cut staffing to where ratios were HORRIBLY unsafe- I'm talking the amount of patient falls and code blues went through the roof. No raises or hazard/covid pay for any staff, despite the government giving them millions. Andrabi made $1.18 MILLION for TWELVE hours of work a week, from Arizona. Meanwhile, I needed anti-depressants and anxiety meds to survive the trauma of watching every patient die for 2 years...for $35/hour. The way this man is getting away with running this organization is absolutely mind blowing. He has fired everyone from the "community," brought in all his friends and they've done nothing but line their pockets.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New London, WI
pros: Floor staff is very supportive of each other and friendly. Have full time staffers to help arrange your schedule. New London hospital is quite flexible considering it's 24/7 operation. The staffers definitely work with you to create a schedule that works for you...may not be done immediately but eventually it'll get done. Every 4th weekend instead of every other is a plus. Floor staff is friendly and works well together considering the working conditions. This review is for Thedacare Medical Center New London only and not Thedacare as a whole.
cons: Dangerously understaffed. Bullying management (sad to say that but true). Management is not willing to listen to insight from floor staff. Management continues to force admissions of new patients even when dangerously staffed. Management times call lights especially when understaffed and uses that data against staff. Management preaches everyone especially RNs need to answer call lights no matter what but they themselves won't help...and in the chance they do help they call you on your zone phone to tell you what the patient wanted (as you can imagine that's actually negative help as obviously you're already busy which is why you didn't answer the call light in the first place). Very unhappy place to work. The grass is much greener on the other side folks. Stay clear! OK for a new grad as this hospital has high turnover and takes a lot of new grads. Seasoned nurses won't give this racket the time of day.... At the end of the day, all things considered, it's management that makes this facility unbearable...not so much the overwork. Floor staff works well together considering the work load.  This review is for Thedacare Medical Center New London and not Theda care as a whole.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Appleton, WI
pros: They provide you a paycheck if you come to work.
cons: No matter how much dedication you give to this company, you are just a number and warm body to fill a position. Their number one priority is their wallet!

pros:
Staff works hard has a “we are all in this together” attitude within departments.
Learning center staff was great for units.
New CEO is reigning in the MDs who were previously beyond reproach. CNAs working units passing NCLEX get jobs on unit along with all the seniority benefits of when they started as CNAs. Hospitalists are very good.
cons:
There is a CYA attitude that permeates the organization. Especially between units, recovery, ER, and OR.
Incident reports are not to learn from but to instead write up or assign blame to staff. Alaris pumps have warnings for proper equipment that is simply unavailable. Benefits cut and tuition reimbursement was a disappointment and not what was described. Raises 2% annually without regard to performance. Yearly incentive’s are much reduced. Nurse educators are no longer present on unit. Favoritism to manager’s pets. Seniority on unit hard to come by because newer staff quits. Traveler RNs with much needed experience replaced with zero experience RNs. Leads on unit take up to a full patient load. CNAs very busy and are often unable to be delegated to. Communication is poor with current phone system. Employees get automatically charged for breaks unless they opt out.

pros: Dedicated, compassionate and supportive floor staff. I am amazed at the commitment to excellence I see in the people I am fortunate enough to work with.
cons: I'm extremely disappointed at how far the current leadership has let this company fall. The implementation of the current staffing model sent over 40% of the nursing staff to other companies. Even though this model has proven to be ineffective,  costly, and even dangerous. The schedules are full of holes which means staff already working 12 hour shifts are constantly being forced over to 16 hours, which has caused a marked increase in errors, injury's to staff, and has subsequently triggered another mass exodus of not only nursing staff, but Doctors, as well. Staff spend valuable time that should be dedicated to patient care, trying to find staff for the next shift. There is also an atmosphere of fear generated by leadership which deters staff from filing formal complaints. Staff that do report abuse from managers, find, at the very least, that nothing is done to rectify the situation, and more likely find themselves written up for insubordination. It seems leadership is only interested in protecting their paychecks. I'm anxiously awaiting confirmation of another position with another company.

review_title: Would be hard to find a better company to work for!!!!!!!
pros: Thedacare is a very nice organization to work for with many different job opportunities and they seem to  prefer to hire within, so lots of growth possibilities. They are very committed to using the "Lean/Simpler principles, and management seems open to new ideas, or at least my reporting manager does.  They are well respected healthcare org in the community so working for them is easy to do.  They have a "no layoff philosophy", so co-workers and I feel pretty secure working for the org.  The benefits are ok, a bit expensive, vacation time allowances are about as good as it gets.  For the most part I am thrilled to work for Thedacare, and have done so for 10 years now.  Lots of people have in over 20 years of employment, turn over is very low.  They employ about 5000 people and most I talk to seem very happy with the company.
cons:
Health benefits are a bit expensive, but most likely not worse than others companies.
They are able to keep the no layoff philosophy by not doing a lot of hiring, so workload can be tough to manage at times.

pros: None honestly what so ever
cons: Scheduling, no life out work.

pros: Pleasant staff to deal with
cons: Not very competitive wages, lower wages

review_title: Didn't leave the job, I left the environment
pros:
The job was good.   Most of the co-workers were good to work with.   I had a little more learning curve on the tools I worked on and they were there to help. 
Flexibility was a good benefit
cons:
Supervisor played favorites and protected who they liked.  Didn't listen to staff on concerns, which made for a tough environment to work in. 
They claim a work-life balance but it wasn't there.
Used to have team building events, and those went away
Compensation was good, but minimal bonuses

pros: The people who work at ThedaCare are incredible. I loved all of my co-workers and everyone helped out others.
cons: They say they have a no layoff policy but do not believe them. They are laying off entire departments and treating the individuals horribly in the process. They may say that it is " career transitions" but when you were previously in a management role and they have nothing available they say we have a job on the floor and you will have to take a cut in pay and benefits but isn't that better than no job at all.

pros: Great Coworkers. Average pay. Newer facilities. Located in a safe community. Good place to raise kids. Used to be a great place to work.
cons: Management is completely out of touch with nurses.  Very poor ability to take even one day off unless scheduled a year in advance. Everyone, in every department, is afraid of getting fired. Mass exodus of nurses this last year, still not done.  They don't value speciality nurses, want people who can flex to all units.  Too many chiefs

review_title: Really great benefits and growth opportunities
pros: I’ve been with ThedaCare for about 3 years. Since Dr. Andrabi started there has been a huge shift to how we provide care and even how we work with each other. So many opportunities to grow into new roles, and the benefits are great. I was surprised when I went to the doctor this year and my co-pay was only $30, when it was $110 at my previous employer.
cons: Sometimes we all get so busy that we forget to focus on the “fun” that we can have in the office. We need to keep looking for ways to do that better.

pros: There are opportunities for advancement.
cons: Employees are treated like numbers, and as the organization grows it gets worse. When I started working at ThedaCare it had a "Family" culture.

review_title: The organization is going through multiple internal changes that are negatively impacting employees.
pros: There is a strong co-worker support system and a wonderful collaborative relationship with providers. High standards are the rule.
cons: There is a lack of listening to the staff when it comes to how to provide quality care to patients. There is a complete disrespect for work-life balance and threats of lay off if staff voice concerns.

pros: ThedaCare is a learning organization that inspires employees to do their best. There is no shame in trying and failing at something here, when things don't go as expected the only expectation is that you share your learning, get up and try again.
cons: We are growing fast and with it comes growing pain. Lots of restructuring and changes to accommodate the needs of this growing organization.

pros: I started working at ThedaCare during the COVID-19 pandemic and I’ve been so impressed with how ThedaCare has treated their employees. They didn’t lay off a single person, while most other healthcare systems did. I feel like our senior leaders really care for all employees and value the work that we do every day. Thank you!
cons: Working remotely feels very different right now, but overall I still feel connected to my peers.

review_title: Positions being eliminated! Lots of restucturing
pros: Benefits, unit manager, co-workers, flexible schedule in my position
cons: The company is restructuring everything.  By doing this they are eliminating several positions.  60 people are currently in "career transitions" which means they let you get pulled to the front of the line if you see a job posting they have.  The problem is the job may not be equivalent to your current position, hours less, pay less, schedule changed.  They also do not have any jobs openings because they are trying to cut 120 FTE.  Managers are stress and work to the brink of break down. It is so sad.  I thought I would stay there forever.

pros: coworkers are very nice.
cons:
16 year employee initially totally committed to the organization. Over the years there has been a significant erosion in employee morale due to many issues. 
1.Most recently has been the decision to focus on the 4 service lines that have highest revenue-oncology, cardiology, elective back, and ortho. Alienating the independent physicians who are the ones that bring revenue into the hospital by admitting patients, booking surgeries, ordering tests and imaging has boggled the mind. In the wisdom of the leadership, if not employed-the enemy. This has caused much difficulty among the physicians and administrators. 
2. Absolute gospel of ThedaCare improvement system. This had taken over all semblance of reasonable problem solving in every aspect of the organization. Now it has been dismantled. No one ever evaluated it as a tool against other problem solving techniques. Now there is an entire bed tower built with goal of total collaborative care ( a brainchild of TIS). Collaborative care has also been eliminated.
3. too many middle managers who honestly know little about the big picture but are willing to do anything to be promoted within the organization
4. until recently, unwillingness to bring in outside ideas
5. increasing funds to TIS/administrators and lack of support of staff. Imposed rules for RN caused major loss of experienced RNs and it has been difficult to recover. So many expensive Travel RN while those with long standing history are not financially compensated. 
6. decision to purchase critical access hospitals with idea that they would fill the larger hospitals. Has not turned out that way and costs for the purchase, building new buildings( Shawano) conversion of EMR has been very high. 
7. Major funds spent on marketing rather than the employees. This is a small community. why the push? They know the competition only too well as has been the same for years. The relationships that existed have in large part been damaged so the marketing has fallen on deaf ears and blind eyes.

review_title: Good Company to work for if your looking for job security
job_title: Business Analyst II in Appleton, WI
pros:
Job Security - You never have to fear of losing your job due to ThedaCares No Lay Off policy.
Pay scale is fair.
Management lets you know your appreciated.
cons:
Heavy Workload - salaried employees put in many hours.
Benefits aren't the best.

pros: I really enjoy the many different patients that I get to meet. In the short time I’ve been here, we have already done a lot to make the registration process much easier at our Encircle location. I’ve only been here for about 7 months, but there’s so many other opportunities. I’m hoping to go back to school to get my BSN, and ThedaCare helps with tuition reimbursement as well.
cons: We are constantly looking to improve as a system, therefore processes are always evolving. If you don’t adjust to change well, then this probably isn’t the role for you.

pros: NONE at all, don't do it.
cons: Theda has proven to be a terrible company to work for the frequently go through "changes" within the company (every 6 month to a year) in which our schedules change, our hours change, they increase patient workload, decrease staff hours. Management is not transparent in the slightest, but they will preach on transparency all day long. Recently they went through over a 1 million dollar rebranding and then after told staff that they had to restructure and cut staff hours CNAs and LPNs have 12 patients on a day shift medical and surgical floor. We have lost vacation time, incentive pay, and been used and abused. DONT COME HERE.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Appleton, WI
pros: Bonuses everywhere!  For picking up weekends, for working overnights, for getting forced over, for short notice shifts.  Also, great management that really tries to work with you and are just nice, professional people.
cons: Flipping back and forth between days and nights.  Sometimes overstaffed (get sent home, no money) sometimes understaffed (get forced over into a 16 hour shift).  Sometimes I can't schedule things because I don't know if I'll be working or not.

pros: The only good thing was I made a few great friends.  I have nothing else good to say about this company.
cons: They only care about the almighty dollar, they do not care about their staff. They will not go out of their way to hear you. Most management is the same way, they don't care. One manager who actually did care they shockingly got rid of, because he went to bat for his staff and they obviously don't like managers who actually care about their staff. Worst company to have ever worked for, best thing I ever did was get out as it just got worse every year.

pros: Good work life balance.  Mostly good team members.  Good manager. Employees earn PTO at a good rate. Reasonable health benefits for the amount we pay.
cons: Scheduling is inconsistent.  Not very direct to employees when policies are changing.  Very money conscious at this time-in turn this is stressful for employees due to a larger workload and less staff.

pros: Lots of ability to be involved in corporate improvements, your voice is heard. Competitive pay and benefits. Good ability for advancement.
cons: Change happens slowly, sometimes decisions should just be made - no need for committees for everything. Sometimes a group spends a week changing something that two people could change over lunchtime.

pros: Not any I can think of.
cons: The administrations attitude is it is their way or the high way.  They tell you that you can be replaced.  They encourage telling on your co-works.  Even if it is something minimal.  And the employee you tattle on could be let go for whatever you tattle on them for.  Medical insurance is overpriced and has  poor coverage.

review_title: Positive energy, fast paced and an innovative company.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Appleton, WI
pros: Thedacare is a great place to work. The people you work with become your family.  They are open to new ideas and supportive with changes.
cons: Changes can happen pretty quickly and not enough time to adjust at times.  Its a big company and sometimes doesn't have that "homey" feel.

pros: They are flexible with hours. They pay is good. There is a no layoff policy.
cons: They hire a lot of relief on call people so they don't have to pay out benefits. The no layoff policy does not include those who work relief on call.

pros: Decent pay. Meet new people. Benefits include insurance and 403b. Employment opportunity within company after 1 year. Sometimes rewarded as a team.
cons: Department is always low on employees. Work load is too much. Management is a mess. Unorganized. Patient standards aren't up to par compared to other hospitals I've worked at. Recognition isn't always given, especially not in front on a group.

review_title: Theda doesn’t care about its employees and only cares about money.
pros: Amazing co-workers, the only reason people stick around.
cons: Management and leadership are clueless about bedside nursing and they are making changes that negatively effect our work. The CEO is the biggest problem, he needs to stop hiring his friends who don’t care about our organization. They keep taking away any “perk” we use to have. No incentives to pick up. Pay is low for the Valley. Benefits are a joke. Always short staffed.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Appleton, WI
pros:
Great employer 403b match
I love my job as an LPN ~ hard, fast paced environment. Great coworkers and management.
cons: Too many changes all at once. Recently eliminating their "colaborative care" nursing status and pursuing "primary" nursing. Thus, phasing out LPNs and prefering mainly RNs and CNAs as a team. Difficult transition for all of us who work on the units.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Appleton, WI
pros:
Managers are very supportive 
Great hours 
Reasonable pay
cons:
Pto used for holidays 
Can only carry 120 hours over per year of pto
Expected to cross train and work outside of own department 
Lots of travel from 1 location go another.

review_title: Care of the staff during covid
pros: ThedaCare has been the best health system for the community and its staff during Covid-19 so far. They haven’t furloughed or laid off any employees. Only upper levels of pay received a pay cut. Great doctors and staff. They care about quality health care and the community.
cons: We are often short staffed—mainly due to MA shortages in our area.

pros: Up to date with technology
cons: I feel as if this healthcare system  has been too focused on business and less on their healthcare staff (providers, nurses, etc.)

pros: I go to Thedacare as a patient and it's always been good. They provide decent benefits. The salary is reasonable.
cons: Since thedacare took over our hospital, there is less focus on the community and patient care. Thedacare is focused on money and a cookie cutter image.  I never know if any of us will be let go. They slowly find ways to get people to leave if they need to save money.

job_title: Talent Acquisition Specialist in Appleton, WI
pros: The leadership demonstrates repeatedly a strategic as well as tactical approach during COVID. This includes not sacrificing our patient to caregiver ratio. Great employee care leads to phenomenal patient care.
cons: The physical separation needed to keep employees healthy and safe during COVID

pros: Wonderful team work and co-employees. Great income and customer care, including communication and documentation.
cons: Was an employee who had [on-call] emergency patients. After being on-call 24/7 including Holidays for 20 plus years; became old school. During moments I was with my children and called into work it became very tiring.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Neenah, WI
pros: Benefits, profit sharing, hourly bonuses for picking up hours above and beyond overtime pay, 12 hour shifts, more time off
cons: Work short occasionally, starting wage is on the lower end of the spectrum,  day and night shift rotation

pros: Amazing co-workers and benefits.  Shift availability
cons: staffing was not reasonable given the acuity of the patients.  Constant change in staffing availability and usually understaffed all around.

pros: Thedacare is an innovative company with lots of opportunities for advancement and training.
cons: 12 hour shifts are hard sometimes but it gives you more time off during  the week.

pros: Love what I do, for the most part Thedacare puts patient care first
cons: Benefits are horrible, No room for human error,

pros: Great organization.  ThedaCare is known worldwide for their successes in improving the patient experience by improving quality and reducing costs.
cons: The pace of change in health care is difficult to keep up.  However, ThedaCare is doing a better than most of its competitors.

review_title: Was a great place to work...

cons: New leadership appears to be preparing the organization for a sale by cutting jobs and using contract labor.

pros: Nothing anymore. Staff tries to do the best they can for patient with what they can.
cons: Short Staffed. No bonuses for part time people

pros: Job security, Lots of transfer/growth opportunities, Nice facilities, Hard-working staff

pros: Uses Epic.  Good cafeteria food
